Literature Review: The intersection of language change, poetic form, and autobiographical narrative is a complex and multifaceted topic that has garnered significant attention in recent years. This literature review aims to explore the relationship between language change and poetic form, with a focus on the autobiographical narrative. We will examine the work of Pāṇini, a renowned ancient Indian grammarian, and discuss the implications of his theories on language change and poetic form. We will also examine the role of autobiographical narrative in shaping our understanding of language change and poetic form.
